definition: in a flash (idiom)
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)
crossball/bullet/shot/shell/ball
finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to wave/to brandish/to command/to conduct/to scatter/to disperse
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms

sentences.english: One stroke, three-year junior high school life coming to an end.
sentences.chinese: 弹指一挥间，三年初中生活就要结束了。

sentences.english: Never thought I also just the creator of the pronto.
sentences.chinese: 却不曾想过自己亦只是造物主的弹指一挥间。

sentences.english: Nine years, in the river of history, perhaps only a twenty.
sentences.chinese: 九十年，在历史的长河中，或许只是弹指一挥间。

sentences.english: Years Rusuo, time flies, six primary school life, a brief span.
sentences.chinese: 岁月如梭，光阴似箭，六年小学生活，弹指一挥间。

sentences.english: Is in a flash, nurtures the person 30 years.
sentences.chinese: 弹指一挥间，育人三十年。

sentences.english: In an instant, thirty years has passed.
sentences.chinese: 弹指一挥间，三十年过去了。

sentences.english: Twenty years is not a long time .
sentences.chinese: 二十年光阴，弹指一挥间。

definition: time flies (idiom)
a white steed flits past a crack (idiom); How time flies!
the sun and moon like a shuttle (idiom); How time flies!
time flies like an arrow (idiom); How time flies!
the passage of the years/the flow of time
lit. a white cloud transforms into what looks like a gray dog (idiom)/fig. the unpredictable changeability of the world
to pass in an instant/over in the twinkling of an eye
lit. the blue sea turned into mulberry fields (idiom)/fig. the transformations of the world
(of time) to pass quickly/to be fleeting
(literary) (of time) to slip away
time available
a snap of the fingers/a short moment/in a flash/in the twinkling of an eye
a snap of the fingers (idiom); in an instant/in a short moment/in a flash/in the twinkling of an eye
eventful years/momentous times
as time goes by (idiom)
in a flash/in the blink of an eye/to glance
